body_html:
I recommend using the CPU-pip version for a few reasons:
1-Installation of CPU pip version is effortless. You can start using tensorflow in 5-10 minutes.
2-If you have a single GPU, that will be used for both display and computation. This is not recommended. When running large training graphs you will almost certainly run into issues due to GPU also being used for display, and this will set you back even further.

I recommend using the CPU-pip version for a few reasons:
1-Installation of CPU pip version is effortless. You can start using tensorflow in 5-10 minutes.
2-If you have a single GPU, that will be used for both display and computation. This is not recommended. When running large training graphs you will almost certainly run into issues due to GPU also being used for display, and this will set you back even further.
body:
I recommend using the CPU-pip version for a few reasons:
1-Installation of CPU pip version is effortless. You can start using tensorflow in 5-10 minutes.
2-If you have a single GPU, that will be used for both display and computation. This is not recommended. When running large training graphs you will almost certainly run into issues due to GPU also being used for display, and this will set you back even further.
